medical_history.chief_complaint: Cutaneous and pulmonary lesions developed after induction chemotherapy for acute myeloid leukemia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 9 days before admission with chills and fever lasting 2 to 3 days. The patient had been hospitalized repeatedly for pancytopenia since a diagnosis of myelodysplastic syndrome 13 months earlier. Following chemotherapy, symptoms progressed, with severe pain in the heels and the development of necrotic plaques.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prior diagnosis of myelodysplastic syndrome 13 months ago. History of hepatitis C virus infection diagnosed approximately 20 years earlier, treated with ribavirin and interferon 27 months prior with a recent plasma showing no detectable viral RNA. History of depression thought to be related to interferon therapy.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of a brain abscess at age 41; mother died of congestive heart failure at age 75.
medical_history.social_history: Single, worked in construction before retirement. Smoked cigarettes for 30 years, history of alcohol abuse decades ago with no recent use. Traveled to the Southwest approximately 30 years earlier.
